WorkItem.Description:
Cells' content likes aligning top-left regardless of Horizontal/VerticalContentAlignment properties of DataGridCell.
 
I think Template setter in DataGridCell's style should be changed like this:
 
<Setter Property="Template">
  <Setter.Value>
    <ControlTemplate TargetType="{x:Type dg:DataGridCell}">
      <Border Background="{TemplateBinding Background}" 
                   BorderBrush="{TemplateBinding BorderBrush}"  
                   BorderThickness="{TemplateBinding BorderThickness}" 
                   SnapsToDevicePixels="True">
        <ContentPresenter SnapsToDevicePixels="{TemplateBinding SnapsToDevicePixels}"
                                    HorizontalAlignment="{TemplateBinding HorizontalContentAlignment}"
                                    VerticalAlignment="{TemplateBinding VerticalContentAlignment}" />
      </Border>
    </ControlTemplate>
  </Setter.Value>
</Setter>
WorkItem.Summary: Broken alignment in WPF DataGrid cells

Comments.Message: This is a known issue and will be addressed in vNext.

I tried making the above change to the DataGridCell's style but I had no luck.
An alternative workaround that doesn't require recompiling the Toolkit is to create a style that sets the VerticalAlignment on the DataGridCell
                    <Style x:Key="defaultCellStyle" TargetType="{x:Type toolkit:DataGridCell}">
                        <Style.Setters>
                            <Setter Property="VerticalAlignment" Value="Center" />
                        </Style.Setters>
                    </Style>

and set the CellStyle on the DataGrid
           <DataGrid CellStyle="{StaticResource defaultCellStyle}" .... >

this worked for me, your mileage may vary.

It'll would be nice to see this fixed properly though.
